page.title: 11SALTHOLME FARM
page.content: { {Saltholme Farm }was first rented by {I.C.I.}from the church commision in 1936 and later bought outright in 1957.It was what lay under the ground, namely{anhydrite}which was I.C.I's main interest.These mine workings are no longer in use but have resulted in some subsidence which has caused the formation of some small lakes and pools.Two of these are in the care of the{Wild Life Trust}as they provide a sanctuary for many migrant birds particularly during the winter months. The farm covers about 5000 acres and supports 430 suckling cows of the French{Charolais}breed,and 1400 sheep.
